content: On Monday, futures contracts for May delivery of West Texas Intermediate were trading in negative figures, which translates into big losses for those left holding the contracts. Ominously, the price for June contracts fell by about 70 percent at one point Tue… [+5964 chars]
source.name: The Washington Post

author: Seung Min Kim
title: Some Senate Republicans look for ways the federal government can play a bigger role in coronavirus testing
description: The dispute over how to efficiently run testing was one of the remaining hurdles resolved in a $484 billion economic stimulus agreement finalized Tuesday, which would also replenish a new small-business lending program whose funds ran dry last week.
content: Led by Sens. Lamar Alexander (R-Tenn.) and Roy Blunt (R-Mo.), Senate Republicans have largely envisioned the federal government taking a lead role in experimenting with diagnostic and serological tests for the coronavirus, even if some of the ideas ultimately… [+7486 chars]
source.name: The Washington Post

author: Juliet Eilperin, Chris Mooney
title: In two states, a vast testing gap shows what it means to have no national strategy - The Washington Post
description: Kentucky and Rhode Island have done nearly the same number of coronavirus tests — but with vastly different sized populations. And that makes all the difference.
content:
The difference suggests Rhode Island probably has a better sense of the viruss spread throughout the state, making it better prepared to curb it.
The contrast offers a clear illustration of the challenges posed by a state-by-state testing strategy, in the ab… [+8405 chars]
source.name: The Washington Post

author: Sarah Kaplan
title: 50 years later, Earth Day’s unsolved problem: How to build a more sustainable world
description: What does it mean to be a good Earthling?
content:
Government responded in stunningly short order. The Environmental Protection Agency was created, a suite of powerful laws were enacted to protect the air, water and endangered species. The release of toxic substances was controlled.
But half a century later,… [+5945 chars]

author: Valerie Strauss
title: Two senators -- a Democrat and a Republican -- urge Betsy DeVos not to gut special education law but provide ‘narrow’ flexibility to school districts
description: They send five principles to the education center to guide her decisions.
content: Some advocates for students with disabilities have written to DeVos, opposing providing any flexibility to IDEA, which requires that schools provide a fair and appropriate education for every student. They say it would be an unacceptable weakening of the law.… [+8318 chars]

author: Matt Viser
title: Michigan cancels contract with two Democratic-linked firms that had been tapped to track coronavirus
description: Gov. Gretchen Whitmer (D) abruptly ended the contract after an outcry over the companies’ Democratic ties.
content:
The Michigan contract, worth nearly $200,000 over the next eight weeks, was signed Monday and allowed the hiring of a subcontractor to help with contact tracing, a process to track residents with the coronavirus and those with whom they have interacted.
The … [+6392 chars]

author: Paul Kane
title: House pushes toward historic change in voting procedures as pandemic sidelines Congress
description: The rules change would, for the first time in the chamber’s more than 230-year history, allow lawmakers to vote in absentia.
content: That is an important first step that I believe we need to put procedures in place to allow remote voting and, I emphasize, remote committee work, House Majority Leader Steny H. Hoyer (D-Md.) told reporters Tuesday on his new weekly media call. He described th… [+5848 chars]

author: Kevin Sieff, Nick Miroff
title: U.S. is deporting infected migrants back to vulnerable countries
description: ICE conducts health screenings, not tests, before putting deportees on planes. Guatemala has stopped receiving the flights.
content:
They arrive 24 hours a day in the Mexican border city of Reynosa, groups of men, women and children deported by the United States. Each time, at the edge of the international bridge, Ricardo Calderón Macias and his team get ready. 
They put on masks and glov… [+8555 chars]

description:

content:
Individuals making $75,000 or less and couples earning up to twice that are eligible to receive $1,200. Theres an extra $500 for each dependent child under 17.
